result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Alan Sandberg

DE's wife called stating DE is in custody in a different county, wondering if DE can appear by zoom to take care of WA.  Clerk advised DE or someone on DE's behalf would have to write a letter to Judge requesting this. Wife plans to inform DE of this info and have him request this in writing. bph

9:07 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Scott Alan Sandberg not in court. Court reviews file. State requests warrant. Court issues WARRANT - body only, adjoining states. Adjourned: 9:08 AM. kma

11:09 AM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott Alan Sandberg appeared by video without permission of the court, allows after speaking w/DE. DE states he does qualify for PD; however has not heard back yet as to appointment. DE to call PD's office to advise of date and time of next hearing. Court makes good cause finding to waive time limits for PH. Adjourned: 11:13 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

NOH for 8/10/22 STC. Address previously updated. Not remailed- will not arrive to DE in time for hearing.  gll

11:22 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Scott Alan Sandberg appeared by video. DE states that he is still trying to find an attorney, works hours have been decreased. Court advises DE to contact public defender. DE states that he still has PFAC form to file if he does not qualify for public defender. Court finds good cause to waive time limits for prelim. Court sets STC to address attorney status and PH time limits. Adjourned: 11:26 AM. kma

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Value Implement.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:01 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris,  Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson with intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott Alan Sandberg in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Scott Alan Sandberg.  Atty Harrelson is unsure if DE qualifies for PD.  Court addresses DE on status of Atty.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond argument.  Court sets bond.  DE to contact PD's office to check on qualification, PFAC given, DE to fill out if he does not qualify. DE updates address.  Adjourned at 2:09 PM. bph
